intro: Galium cometerhizon, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically has slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, clustered in small umbels, and bloom in early summer. Galium cometerhizon is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
